Pre-Game Insights: The Los Angeles Angels aim to break a four-game losing streak when they take on the Houston Astros.
The Astros hold a 5-3 advantage in the season series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The matchup Sunday is the ninth time these teams square off this season.
Taylor Ward leads Los Angeles with 23 home runs while slugging.432.
Yordan Alvarez leads the Astros with a.310 batting average, and has 31 doubles, two triples, 34 home runs, 64 walks and 84 RBI.
Others: Los Angeles has a 60-88 record overall and a 30-44 record in home games. The Angels are 37-21 in games when they out-hit their opponents.
Houston is 38-36 on the road and 80-68 overall. The Astros have a 15-26 record in games decided by one run.
